thread.title: Eddie 'The Eagle' Edwards 'AXED' from The Jump after confessing health and safety concerns
thread.title_full: Eddie 'The Eagle' Edwards 'AXED' from The Jump after confessing health and safety concerns

author: Nicola Agius
title: Eddie 'The Eagle' Edwards 'AXED' from The Jump after confessing health and safety concerns
text:
Eddie 'The Eagle' Edwards 'AXED' from The Jump after confessing health and safety concerns The Channel 4 series is thought to be one of the most dangerous shows on TV Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Get celebs     
The Jump has reportedly axed Eddie 'The Eagle' Edwards. 
According to The Sun, Channel 4 bosses decided to drop the 53-year-old after he raised health and safety issues about the show. 
"Producers didn’t like what he was saying about the show as it came in for a lot of stick," a source told The Sun. 
"They are really sensitive because of the amount of people who have broken their legs or been seriously hurt. The Jump has reportedly axed Eddie 'The Eagle' Edwards (Photo: Getty) 
"It would be hard for Eddie to appear on the show after his comments because he would have to explain them and there is a high chance someone else will get injured." Read More Liverpool ace Robbie Fowler is a flop as he hits the slopes for the latest series of The Jump 
Back in October, Eddie publicly revealed he had concerns about The Jump after a number of celebrities injured themselves during last year's series. Channel 4 bosses have reportedly decided to drop the 53-year-old after he raised health and safety issues about the show (Photo: Getty) 
Speaking at the Cheltenham Literature Festival he told the audience that Channel 4 bosses had ignored his advice and he was stunned to learnt that the show was returning for a forth series given the casualties in 2016. 
He said: "I kept telling the producers, ‘It’s going to get very difficult, very hairy’ and they said, ‘No it’s all right’ and they’ve carried on and they’ve had so many accidents. I was very surprised that they’re going to have another series." The Jump bosses blamed Eddie's departure on an 'editorial decision' (Photo: BabiradPicture/REX/Shutterstock) 
Channel 4 have cited that Eddie's departure was an "editorial decision". 
Mirror Online has contacted The Jump and Eddie for further comment. Like us on Facebook
